contextId.information: The abstract nouns "wisdom" and "understanding" can be translated as adjective phrases, and the abstract noun "sight" refers to how the peoples judge or decide on the value of something. AT: "this is what will show the peoples that you are wise and that you understand what is important" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the peoples

contextId.information: The abstract noun "assembly" can be expressed as the verb "gather together." AT: "on the day when you Israelites all came and met together in one place" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: on the day of the assembly

contextId.information: This abstract noun can be stated as a verb. AT: "God will curse you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "rebellion" can be stated as a verb. AT: "he has tried to make you rebel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "verdict" can be stated as a verb. AT: "they will decide on the matter" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: they will give you the verdict

contextId.information: The abstract noun "the evil" can be stated as an adjective. AT: "by punishing the false witness, you will stop this evil practice within your nation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: you will remove the evil from among you

contextId.information: The abstract noun "reputation" can be translated as a verb phrase. AT: "and makes other people think she is a bad person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: and puts a bad reputation on her

contextId.information: The abstract noun "proof" can be translated as a verb phrase. AT: "must take something that proves that she was a virgin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: must take proof of her virginity

contextId.information: The abstract nouns "proof" and "virginity" can be translated as verb phrases. AT: "But this proves that my daughter was a virgin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: But here is the proof of my daughter's virginity

contextId.information: The abstract noun "reputation" can be translated as a verb phrase. AT: "has caused people to think that a virgin of Israel is a bad person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: has caused a bad reputation for a virgin of Israel

contextId.information: The abstract nouns "delicateness" and "tenderness" can be stated as clauses. AT: "because she is so delicate and tender" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
This abstract noun can be translated as a verb. AT: "that the enemy would provoke me" or "that the enemy would cause me to be angry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "justice" can be translated as a verb. AT: "For Yahweh will do what is just for his people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: For Yahweh will give justice to his people

contextId.information: The abstract noun "help" can be translated as a verb. AT: "help him to fight" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The abstract noun "refuge," which means a shelter or a place safe from danger, can be stated as a verb. AT: "The eternal God will protect his people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: The eternal God is a refuge
